anime.description: * Based on Touken Ranbu, collectible card browser video game by Nitroplus and DMM Games. Note: Episode 1 was shown in cinemas nationwide on May 1, 2017. Episodes 1-3 were shown during a special preview event on June 30, 2017.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: bishounen
tag.description: Young man whose beauty (and sexual appeal) transcends the boundary of gender or sexual orientation.

tag.name: sword
tag.description: A sword is a long, edged piece of metal, used as a cutting, thrusting, and clubbing weapon in many civilizations throughout the world. Before firearms became commonplace, and fast enough to render other weapons pointless in the battlefield, they were the main kind of weapon for war and duels alike. A sword fundamentally consists of a blade and a hilt, typically with one or two edges for striking and cutting, and a point for thrusting. That aside, however, they may come in all sorts of designs: the medieval European swords used to be big, heavy weapons that did not actually cut but instead broke the enemy`s bones under their armor; conversely, the Chinese jian sword (called "ken" in Japanese) attempted to exploit the armor`s joints and perforate the enemy`s flesh in those places, but was useless against the armor itself, and did not take the strikes, preferring to redirect them, to this day being considered a highly "circular" weapon and associated to taijiquan; on the other hand, the Japanese katana was a balanced all-purposes weapon that could be used even in an axe-like way, but which a master swordsman could use in many other, more elaborate manners.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: time travel
tag.description: In time travel anime characters are transported through time either figuratively or literally to find themselves either in the past or the future

tag.name: historical
tag.description: Historical anime have clear ties to our history and usually occur in a particular epoch.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: DESCRIPTION MISSING
tag.description: The description for this entry is missing. e.g plot, biography... Please help by adding it, and remove this tag afterwards. Thank you.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: 出陣
To the Frontlines
Départ au front
출진
Shutsujin
episode.summary: Horikawa Kunihiro has manifested as a Sword Warrior and is joined by Izuminokami Kanesada, a warrior who served under the same master as him. With a single goal in mind, the two rush through the mountains… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 守りたかったもの
What I Wanted to Protect
Ce qu`on voulait protéger
지키고 싶었던 것
Mamoritakatta Mono
episode.summary: A new mission brings the Second Unit to Edo, where the tension between the pro-shogunate forces and the Imperial army are so hot, you could almost set it on fire. With plenty of room for the Time Retrograde Army to alter history, will Izuminokami and his team be able to stop them? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 主の命[あるじのめい]
Master`s Orders
Les ordres du maître
주군의 명령
Aruji no Mei
episode.summary: As the mystery is unfolding, the Second Unit is now having trouble keeping themselves together. A small fight breaks out between Kanesada and Mutsunokami. Kunihiro suggests to Kanesada that they work separately in two teams. Will it be wise to split the party? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 部隊長
Commander
Le commandant
부대장
Butaichou
episode.summary: With the newly arrived reinforcements, Saniwa and his unit push through the castle to find out why the Time Retrograde Army is here in this era. However, time runs out, and their Master Saniwa must return to the Citadel. He leaves Kanesada in charge of the unit, but will he be able to unite everyone and solve this mystery? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 歴史を守る
Protect History
Protéger l`Histoire
역사를 지킨다
Rekishi o Mamoru
episode.summary: Honebami thinks the First Unit has successfully completed their mission, but their captain tells them that they have one more mission. Meanwhile, at the citadel, Izuminokami was still in turmoil from his previous mission, but Horikawa cheers him up. He then goes around to everyone in his unit, and asks them a certain question… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 第一部隊
The First Unit
La 1re troupe
제1부대
Dai Ichi Butai
episode.summary: The First Unit mobilizes! With the old captain watching over this duplicate of a new captain, what kind of powerful monster could be waiting for them? As Honebami joins the First Unit as their newest member, he encounters a being from his past… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本丸
The Citadel
La Citadelle
혼마루
Honmaru
episode.summary: As Kanesada watches Edo, everyone is teleported back to the Citadel. While the Second Unit recuperates for the time being, they are still waiting for that person to wake up. At this time, Kanesada seeks help from the eccentric and mysterious First Unit Captain. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 戦火
The Fires of War
La guerre
전화
Senka
episode.summary: A mysterious figure appears before Yagen. Is he friend or foe? I think Yagen might be surprised. As Horikawa and Tonbokiri continue to fend off that giant ootachi, the others board the warship to join Yagen. Will they figure out the Time Retrograde Army’s plan in time to stop them from succeeding? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 箱館戦争
Battle of Hakodate
La bataille de Hakodate
하코다테 전쟁
Hakodate Sensou
episode.summary: Kunihiro has decided to pursue his own loyalty. What could that even be? In the midst of chaos, Saniwa descends upon Izuminokami and Mutsunokami. After briefly discussing the situation, he takes them to the area where the Battle of Hakodate is taking place. What could Saniwa want to do here? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鉄の掟
Iron Law
La loi du fer
철의 규정
Kurogane no Okite
episode.summary: Horikawa Kunihiro has gone missing. The Second Unit realizes they haven’t seen him since the plum tree incident. Izuminokami and Mutsunokami try to search for him, but Izuminokami finds Kunihiro in the strangest of places… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忠義の向かう先
Where Loyalty Leads
Le chemin vers la loyauté
충의가 향하는 곳
Chuugi no Mukau Saki
episode.summary: Even though their mission is complete, Saniwa asks the Second Unit to stay in that era. While continuing to monitor Sakamoto Ryoma’s safety, Horikawa begins to question why the Touken Danshi can’t see their former master, and how would he himself react if he ever sees his former master again… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 元の主[あるじ]
Former Master
Le précédent maître
전 주인
Moto no Aruji
episode.summary: No more casual clothes and relaxing at the Citadel anymore! The Second Unit mobilizes with a fresh start, and lands in Kyoto 1866. Here, they need to protect one of the Touken Danshi’s former masters. However, due to a certain rule, they need to avoid seeing their former master if possible. Will they be able to protect him while not getting into contact with him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 活撃
Katsugeki
L`assaut
활격
Katsugeki
episode.summary: The conclusion of the Battle of Hakodate and the fate of Hijikata Toshizou unfold. Was Kunihiro able to pursue his loyalty? Was Izuminokami able to protect history? The season comes to a conclusion as the Time Retrograde Army unleashes its force of 1,000 upon Hakodate! Source: crunchyroll
